item.title: Poly1305 - Introduction
item.description: Table of Contents Part 1 - Introduction Part 2 - Benchmarking Part 3 - Optimizing and speed up About Poly1305 Poly1305 is a cryptographic message authentication code (MAC) created by Daniel J. Bernstein. It can be used to verify the data integrity and the authenticity of a message. A variant of Bernstein’s Poly1305 that does not require AES has been standardized by the Internet Engineering Task Force in RFC 8439.
